alert.note: Alert for Dauphin (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 04 at 7:14PM EST until February 05 at 2:34AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Pennsylvania... Swatara Creek Above Middletown affecting Dauphin County. For the Swatara Creek...including Middletown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Swatara Creek Above Middletown. * WHEN...From this evening to just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, Minor overbank flooding begins near the Vine Street Bridge downstream to the Susquehanna River. At 12.0 feet, Both banks overflow upstream of the Vine Street Bridge and several basements are affected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM EST Friday the stage was 10.9 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this evening to a crest of 11.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage later tonight. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 245 AM EST.
